description: Borrowed from Latin abiūdicātus, perfect passive participle of abiūdicō (“deprive or take away by judicial sentence”), from ab (“from, away from”) + iūdicō (“pass judgement; determine, conclude”). Doublet of abjudge. See judge.

verbs.description: abjudicate (third-person singular simple present abjudicates, present participle abjudicating, simple past and past participle abjudicated)
